articles.description: Cameron Norrie needs a shock win over Novak Djokovic to keep alive Great Britain's hopes of beating Serbia and reaching the Davis Cup semi-finals.
articles.title: Draper loss means Norrie must beat Djokovic at Davis Cup

articles.description: For a player who is supposedly not fully fit, Chelsea striker Sam Kerr still managed to be the difference-maker against Paris FC in the Women's Champions League.
articles.title: 'Brilliant Kerr shows class despite only being 80% fit'

articles.description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton denies claims by Christian Horner he approached Red Bull about a move there earlier this year.
articles.title: Hamilton denies Horner's Red Bull approach claims

articles.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ and Everton fan Barry Can't Swim for this weekend's Premier League predictions.
articles.title: Sutton's Premier League predictions v DJ & Everton fan Barry Can't Swim

articles.description: Katie Taylor promises a "completely different fight" against Chantelle Cameron in their rematch on Saturday.
articles.title: Underdog Taylor vows to grasp 'second chance'

articles.description: Watch as Novak Djokovic beats Britain's Cameron Norrie to seal Serbia's place in the Davis Cup semi-finals.
articles.title: Djokovic beats Norrie to book Serbia's last-four spot

articles.description: England Test captain Ben Stokes makes himself unavailable for the 2024 Indian Premier League to manage his workload and fitness.
articles.title: Stokes skips 2024 IPL to manage fitness and workload

articles.description: An FA Council member who wrote on social media that "Adolf Hitler would be proud of Benjamin Netanyahu" resigns.
articles.title: Haq quits FA Council after Hitler-Netanyahu post

articles.description: As the United States celebrates Thanksgiving BBC Sport takes a look back at some of the best Premier League goals by Americans.
articles.title: Watch best goals by Americans in the Premier League

articles.description: A Spanish prosecutor is seeking a prison term of nine years for ex-Brazil and Barcelona defender Dani Alves.
articles.title: Prosecutor seeks nine-year prison term for Alves
